meanings.definition: To expel air forcibly from the mouth and nose due to irritation or a cold.
meanings.sent1: She sneezes loudly when she has a cold.
meanings.sent2: He always sneezes when he is around cats.
meanings.sent3: The baby sneezes so much, it's like a little trumpet playing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter sneezes out of her like confetti.
meanings.sent5: The old car sneezes smoke from its exhaust pipe.

meanings.definition: A sudden, involuntary expulsion of air from the nose and mouth due to irritation or illness.
meanings.sent1: His sneezes echoed through the quiet library.
meanings.sent2: The doctor said her frequent sneezes were due to allergies.
meanings.sent3: The sneezes of the clown made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The sneezes of the volcano sent ash into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The loud sneezes of the elephant startled the other animals.
